name: Classic Turkey and Rice Soup
author: Sarah
summary: Is there anything as warm as a bowl of soup made with the leftovers of a meal that you shared with your family?
ingredients: 1 large onion, halved and skin left on
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Combine turkey carcass, halved onion, roughly chopped carrot, roughly chopped celery, halved garlic head, 1 teaspoon rosemary, thyme, bay leaves, salt, and pepper in a stockpot; pour in enough water to cover
Bring mixture to a boil, cover pot, reduce heat, and simmer until flavors have blended, about 1 hour
Remove turkey carcass and pull remaining meat from bones; reserve meat and discard carcass
Remove vegetables and bay leaves from stock using a slotted spoon and discard
Stir diced onions, diced carrots, diced celery, minced garlic, poultry seasoning, 1 teaspoon rosemary, and onion powder into stock; bring to a boil
Reduce heat, cover pot, and simmer until vegetables are very tender, 20 to 30 minutes
Add cooked rice and turkey meat to soup; season with salt and pepper
Cook until rice and turkey meat are warmed, about 5 minutes
